review.reviewBody: Writing this review to thank Mike Bova/team for getting this power pack to me asap. I utilized it during my 277 mile ride across Georgia. It held up though 100miles of a tropical storm (extremely heavy rain/high winds/cold) and more.  I even transferred the power source to my front light during the night and I still had battery life when I was complete. Utilization time was roughly 16.5 hours.
review.name: Race Across Georgia 2023

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my fat tire race in January as was only moderately satisfied. It works, but dies really fast in the cold. All my other power packs held up for the 32 hours I was on the go...this unit was flat out dead within the first 8 hours.
review.name: cold weather review

review.reviewBody: We've had our Limestone 6p for about 8 camping seasons in the PNW. I got it after constantly getting wet in our other tents and so that my tall husband could stand up comfortably and move around. It felt like $$$ at the time but it has been amazing which is why I'm here to write this review. I love the extra dry front and back porch areas for shoes and things we want to protect. Nice large doors for coming and going, lots of pockets inside and a hook to hang a light. So quick and easy to put up. We're always careful to store dry and clean. For the first time this year, it had one tiny drip coming through the rainfly where the seam tape was peeling up. (I've submitted my first warranty claim so we'll see how that process works.) Admittedly, most of our camping is in forested areas but I can see how the lightweight poles might not hold up as well in a place with high winds. 100% would buy this tent again.
review.name: Keeps us dry and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I purchased our tent Christmas 2015 and started camping with it in 2016. We have camped in her 20-48 days per year from as early as April to the beginning of November. Most of our  tent’s time was spent in the Canadian Rockies in a variety of weather. She has experienced Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta, British Columbia, Northwest Territories and North and South Dakota. She has kept us dry, cool, warm and cozy all these years. Both tent zippers to the front and back have been replaced. The fly has numerous patches. This year 2 sections of both poles were bent during a strong wind while trying to set her up in Grasslands National Park in Saskatchewan. Unfortunately they cannot be straightened. The fly is very thin from exposure to various types of weather. I chose the Limestone tent as it’s tall enough to  stand up in, otherwise my husband wouldn’t have agreed to camp in a tent. It’s also very easy to assemble, take down and store in provided bag. The main tent is still in great shape. My husband is 81 and his memory is starting to fail. He wants to continue to camp as long as he is able, therefore, having the same tent would be beneficial as with a little reminding, he can still assist in tent assembly and take down. She will last a couple of more trips this year then I’ll be searching for a replacement.
review.name: Quick setup

review.reviewBody: We've had problems with bent and broken poles and the carry bag ripping within the first year of use. The quality isn't what you'd expect.
review.name: Not that great
comment:
Hello there
 
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
We also have a life time warranty for our products, so if you have any issues with our product feel free to start a warranty claim on our website.
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
After doing significant research on multi person tents, I decided on a Marmot Limestone 6 person tent.  That was back in 2012.  We have been camping in the tent every season except two.  We have taken exceptional care of this tent (never putting it away damp, keeping it away from campfires, and storing it in a suitable tent tote) and in turn, this tent has kept up warm, dry and given us many memories of mother/daughter camping.
One summer we were camping in WI and were hunkered down during a severe thunderstorm.  As loud as it was with the rain AND hail pounding on the rain fly, we were safe and dry in our Marmot Limestone tent.  We actually had a small stream running under the tent, but not a drop inside!
The gear pockets are great and it sleeps three people quite comfortably on twin air beds and our gear.  The entryway are a bonus for keeping your gear dry from the night dew and there is plenty of head room for standing up and changing clothes.
We did have warranty work done this year and service was fast helpful!
We absolutely love our Marmot!
review.name: Durable Tent - Great Warranty

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The tent is extra roomy and looks robust. However after all night strong side winds poles bended likes the trees facing north but without having broken . The tent is used only during summer season since it's very well ventilated. It hasn't face rain yet.The biggest disadvantage is sure the sunlight that comes unhindered inside at kiwi coloured tent. Unfortunately it was the only colour available in Greece.Just before the purchase rapidly passed my mind both the brightness of the mesh and flysheet but having no other option I bought it. Unfortunately neither the white mesh makes it to improve the privacy in addition you must be prepared to wake up early especially when summer. I am 174 cm and find difficulty to install the flysheet without a small help from my wife. All the previous settings can be done very very fast and incredibly easy
review.name: Nice tent bad poles very bright inside
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our Limestone 6-Person Tent product. We truly appreciate you bringing the design matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:
 
https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I bought my limestone about a year ago and have been out in it about 7 times now primitive camping and I love it. It is an easy set up and on two of my trips I had some severe storms come in, the one alone had about 40mph winds with it and the tent shook some but it weathered the storm( no pun intended). Very easy to do a one person set up with and I really enjoy the space and head room.
review.name: Marmot Limestone 6p

review.reviewBody: On my third gentle use I had three poles break.  Unfortunately, They did not have replacement poles and has been a challenge to find replacement poles.   On the plus side they did send me a check for the replacement value.
review.name: Nice tent but bad poles

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tent is very spacious, perfect for a couple and dog.  It fits a double air mattress with lots of room to spare.  It has lots of mesh and good air flow, great for summer camping.  I would recommend if you are looking for a quality constructed tent that is easily to put up.
review.name: Great tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very spacious, great high ‘roof’, let a little water in during a consistent rain on its first use, rainfly is not easy to get in/out of.
review.name: Good tent!

review.reviewBody: I bought the Mountainsmith Tour lumbar pack last year, and found that I couldn't really use it happily because it pulled away from my back when full. So this year I bought the strapettes (they were sold out last year when I could have used them), and these straps have transformed the lumbar pack! I've just returned home from a walking trip using the lumbar pack with the strapettes - every day, all day, for 11 days of walking and 113 miles, and just loved how comfortable the straps were and how great they made the pack. Perfect combo!
review.name: Love these strapettes!

review.reviewBody: The Strappettes make the Mountainsmith Day Lumbar Pack become an intergrated part of your body.  I have use a MS Lumbar Pack on and off for years.   While the stock shoulder strap helps set up the right geometry for a comfortable carry, the Strappettes absolutely nail it.  Even with a light load (two water bottles and a shell) it's worth using the Strappettes. The waist belt and cinch straps can be set to a very comfortable just snug tightness an the load simply disappears. I can't wait to try them with a heavier load.
review.name: An Absolute Must

review.reviewBody: I have used several backpacks over the years and the radix 57 is my favorite.  It is lite weight, comfortable and the external pockets allows easy access to a lot of gear as needed.
review.name: Its a great backpack

review.reviewBody:
I've had this pack for a few months now and have gotten a few hundred miles under it with varying loads and equipment needs. From overnight fishing trips where I hauled my pole and tacklebox to multi day trips through rocky alpine trails, this pack has been fantastic. Mystery Ranch is the king of comfort, and is my go to brand when it comes to the majority of my trips. 

The robust hip belt, quality load lifters, and torso length adjusting system really lets you dial in the perfect fit. The only negative I can bring up on that point is I wish there was an option for the running vest style sported by the Bridger series. That running vest style REALLY helped distribute the load across your shoulders and brought your chest into the support system. If I'm hauling extra gear (fishing equipment, ice axes, gear for my dog, camera equipment, etc.) I really want the ability to spread the weight bearing across as much of my body as I can. I sometimes find myself eye-balling my Bridger 65 over my Radix 57 when I'm hauling my tripod and DSLR.

This is not an ultralight pack, but its a good measure lighter than traditional-styles of backpacks while still managing to handle weight far better than most UL packs. The cost is competitive with packs of similar quality, though I feel like I haven't QUITE gotten my money's worth with this product as of yet. It's strong, fairly water-resistant, and has great space inside the bag with a comfortable diameter of the interior pocket. Though it's missing the great organization of the Bridger series, the brain and outer pockets of this bag offer plenty of organization for 99% of backpackers. I love the large side pockets that allowed me to fit a 1.5 L Hydrapak bottle and my trekking poles one side with my poop kit, camp chair, and 1 L Hydrapak bottle in the other. The open tube-style paired with the full length zipper really scratches the annoying itch I have with other-brand UL tube style packs where you nearly have to climb inside to access your gear at the bottom of your pack.

Overall this is a great product for a MOSTLY fair price. I rated 5 stars on Value but in my eyes, it barely makes that 5th star. The state of backpacking gear is overpriced as a whole so I feel like I can't blame Mystery Ranch for just competing with the market. Plus I like buying American. You'd be hard pressed to find a pack that's THIS comfortable for this price to weight ratio.
review.name: Great Pack, but nothing is perfect!

review.reviewBody: This new pack replaces my Dana Design Terraplane bought in 1995. I just took it out on a 3 day trip in SW Colorado and am very pleased with this pack. The craftsmanship is excellent, which is expected from Dana. But, what I love are the outside pockets. These 3 pockets are roomy but can be cinched down to nothing if you don't need them. Also, the pack has a multitude of features that can shed weight if that is important to you. All of the straps, waist belt, and top pocket are removable. What is most important to me is the comfort and this pack is as comfortable and adjustable as my old terraplane. This pack distributes the weight evenly and allows the user to move weight from hips to shoulders while hiking.
review.name: What I expected from Dana.

review.reviewBody:
I was previously using a Coulee 50, and love everything about it other than the size being a touch too small. Radix 57 seemed like the perfect upgrade. Turns out it has WAY more room, since that 57 liters doesn’t include the enormous outer pockets. 

Pros:
1. Pocket layout is great. Good amount of space in the brain, the tiny key holder pocket is perfect and includes a lanyard, and the shove-it pockets are spacious yet cinch down. 
2. Light enough to make a great summit pack too. And speaking of that, there is plenty of clearance to be able to look up while scrambling/climbing. 
3. Just fits a bear vault 450 sideways in the bottom. Awesome!
4. Fabric is very durable especially considering g the light weight. 

Cons:
1. The hip belt is tiny and weak sauce. The buckles are microscopic and do not have enough friction to keep the belt from loosening up. The pads are a okay but this loosening almost had me ditch the pack, until I decided to throw on my coulee 50 hip belt. Problem solved! If this affects you reach out to MR for one of those belts. Bonus is it’s a bit bigger overall and distributes weight better. 
2. Main bag is very tall, which isn’t bad, but it needs a second drawstring 8 inches or so down from the top. Like older, bigger MR packs. Loads that sit above the upper compression strap get a bit floppy. This is pretty nitpicky though and shouldn’t stop anyone from buying this. 

Overall a great pack and I would recommend it, especially considering there’s a solution if the hip belt isn’t working out.
review.name: Great bag design, don’t love the hipbelt

review.reviewBody:
Review by Mike (Mozzie)
Review by Mike (Mozzie)

I recently used the Mystery Ranch Radix Series pack on the Oregon/Washington portion of the PCT, covering nearly 1,000 miles. My initial review was not based on actual usage, but I stand by much of what I originally said. Many straps are excessively long, and a roll top with the brain would be a fantastic addition.

Having spent considerable time buying and using ultralight packs, I own a Granite Gear Blaze 60, Outdoor Vitals Shadowlight, and a couple of lightweight Gregory packs. I’ve also completed many long-distance trails. When Mystery Ranch released the Radix Series, I jumped at the chance to try one, despite its heavier weight.

The waist belt pockets were excellent, and the zippers worked smoothly throughout the trip. However, I found the side pockets for holding a Nalgene-type water bottle inconvenient, as I always had to remove the pack to access the bottle. I didn’t use the hydration sleeve because it’s too difficult to keep a bladder clean on a long hike. Once I got the pack dialed in, it was very comfortable. Even on resupply days when I added 8-10 lbs of food or had a long water carry, the pack’s performance remained consistent.

I did encounter an issue with one of the fasteners that held the top on. It wouldn’t hold, and when it slipped, it threw the pack off balance. I ended up tying the strap to prevent it from slipping. Overall, this pack is excellent—rugged and showing very little wear even after taking falls. I highly recommend it for anyone who values quality and isn’t obsessed with ounces.

PS: I carried between 29 and 35 lbs depending on the number of days between resupply.
review.name: Quality over ounces!

review.reviewBody: After trying out many different packs (Osprey Atmos AG 65, Osprey Aether 65, Gregory Baltoro 65,  Terraframe 3-Zip 50), the Radix 57 was the one that fit and felt the best for my body. Some people reported that the padding isn't enough for the Radix but for me, it's just perfect. I didn't like the thick padding like on the Atmos AG, etc.. it just felt "too much". The Radix also has just the perfect amount of loops and whatnot while still maintaining a "minimal" feel to it.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Super light, great fitting on the fly,  I've stuck with mystery ranch  for years, no complaints, just quality adventures/journeys world.wide
review.name: Super nice bag

review.reviewBody: I replaced my NorthFace Banchee 65 with the Radix 57. And the ease of loading and unloading the backpack is just freaking awesome.
review.name: Absolutely Best Backpack!

review.reviewBody: Pack is lightweight and durable so far.  Ive only used it a few times with a full loadout. ( including a 10lb tent, sleeping bag, sleeping pad, food and water.)
review.name: Lightweight and Strong

review.reviewBody: I have a Terraframe 65 that has served me well for quite a few years but with age and wisdom I decided I wanted something lighter. I was researching ultralight packs when I saw a YouTube review of the Radix 57 and I decided to buy it in February. I have around a 50 late winter miles on it so far. The build quality is good with the expected tradeoffs of a lightweight product. I don’t like the finicky small buckles that are tough to use with gloves on but I’ll get used to them I suppose. The waist belt is comfortable with adequate sized pockets. The shoulder straps are comfortable. The yoke adjusts easily. The only real miss is the side pocket design. It is difficult to get a water bottle in and out of them while wearing the pack. It becomes impossible [for me at least) while winter backpacking when I wear a bulkier jacket and gloves. I am 6 ft/200 lbs with decent to good flexibility in my shoulders and torso but the location, angle and top hem of the pockets just aren’t conducive for easy access of a water bottle while wearing the pack. Again, this could just be me. Your experience may be different. I like the pack overall, more so when I use a water bladder instead of bottles. It’s just that using a water bladder works against being able to have a lighter load.
review.name: Carries well

name: Radix 57L Backpack - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Trailbreaker Tour Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Former competitive skier; have worn a few days in Lake Tahoe early season (mid-20s/30s and sunny).  Very pleased.  Fit great (5'11 / 190 athletic build - large is perfect).  Paired with a light base layer-  plenty warm.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome ski/snowboard pants

review.reviewBody: I use these as my primary ski touring pant for winter in CO. They have great stretch and they are water resistant enough for daily use. Great vents and pockets. I think I am on my 4th pair!
review.name: Daily ski touring pant

review.reviewBody: The Pant moves well with your body as you work your way through the deep stuff as well as the skin track on the Level and Steep as well on your Downs Great Fit and extremely comfortable and breathable Offers great layering decisions for adjusting to your trip conditions and levels of intensity throughout your day Beacon Pocket is in an area I like as well Lots of Zip Pockets and Side Zips to vent when you are all Lathered Up from the intense workouts up the Steep or wherever Cuff Scuff protection etc I really enjoy these Pants when I'm out in the Backcountry Alpine Whitestuff and being Active doing whatever the Active Alpine throws my way Work great for Skiing, Shoeing, Mountaineering, Trekking, Winter Scrambling, Climbing Ice Wall stuff especially if you have mixed trips and adventures where you might be up against it and need to push on thru instead of just activity specific gear for days in the Great White Frozen Alpine Environs I really enjoy wearing the Trailbreakers
review.name: Fabulous Backcountry Active Alpine Touring Pant

review.reviewBody: I've only used the pants on one outing so far and they seem to be a good option. I am 6', 220 lbs, and was on the fence whether to get L or XL. I went with L and I am glad I did. The pants are a bit warmer than I anticipated as the fabric is brushed in some areas or where it is layered (e.g. pockets) but are a lot less warm and more breathable than my shells.
review.name: First use and fit

review.reviewBody: Bought these for climbing Katahdin in Maine and they performed great, kept me cool on the ascent and were warm enough for the summit and around camp. Wasn't snowy so can't speak for waterproofing. Softshell in the thighs is definitely chilly if its windy and you aren't generating much heat.
review.name: Great pants for touring and spring skiing

review.reviewBody: For ski touring I love everything about these pants. The cut, the color options, and the thoughtful details (the dedicated suspender attachment points, the red zipper on the beacon pocket, and the crampon guards to name a few) make me happy to recommend them.
review.name: Best ski touring pant I've ever used!

review.reviewBody: All the features that I want, nothing that I don't. I've owed a few of the top brands through the years and these are the best.
review.name: Excellent ski touring pants, best ever

review.reviewBody: keeps me dry and warm in the heavy snow in the cascade mountains. has all the right features for easy on and off.
review.name: dry and warm in the heavy snow

review.reviewBody: I love these softshell hybrid pants. They are fantastic in the snow and fit better and more comfortably than most I've tried. I'm 6' and 190# (33" waist) and the Medium is perfect. I would imagine anyone with a shorter inseam would find these long and perhaps baggy. Too bad there aren't length options. They work great for winter hiking/snowshoeing/shoveling the driveway/snow play w the doggo. Layer great with long johns. They seem like an excellent fit for touring, especially with the good breathability, stretch, and generous venting option with the side zippers, but I haven't yet got out this season. Waterproof and reinforced lowers a nice feature, especially when... breaking trail. With ski boots I'm pretty sure I could get away with a shorter length even at 6' / 32" inseam, but then they would be a bit short the rest of the time. Most snow pants bunch up with a bit of a baggy look over ski boots anyway. Would buy again.
review.name: Top notch snow pants

review.reviewBody: I've taken these out on a couple of tours, and so far they are holding up to the abuse. They're comfortable, they stretch, and I like the pockets and easy to use vent zippers.
review.name: Nice touring pants

review.reviewBody: Meets expectations. great deal on sale. seems like durable construction. pre taping was nice. had to swap the xdr for a different freehub but i still think it was a pretty good deal. installed 45 mm tires tubeless and they ride just fine. I think you could honestly go a little bigger. came well packaged and included a couple of spare spokes!
review.name: good value wheels

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for a spare set of wheels so that I can easily change my tubeless tires from 38mm slicks to 42mm knobbies- at $150 for these aluminum wheels I couldn't pass them up. I've ridden them for 300+ miles so far, nothing to say. Same weight as my DT Swiss G1800, bottom of the line hubs. Good so far!
review.name: Great value wheels-

review.reviewBody: Bought a new bike and moved carbon wheels over to it. Put these on my old bike as a spare bike. I honestly can’t tell the difference too much. These are great wheels for a great  price.
review.name: Totally good enough

review.reviewBody:
A great looking wheelset. Amazing Deal (got it at 57% off)
Came pre-taped with the stem installed.

A bit of an issue with product description. There is nothing on the page about what freehub it comes with. I reached out to support and the said it came with a HG freehub.

Wheels arrived and they had a XDR freehub...

Reached out to both Backcountry support and DT Swiss, and the freehub body that backcountry sells (3-Pawl Freehub Body and End Cap. Road, HG, 12x142mm
3-Pawl Freehub Body and End Cap. Road, HG, 12x142mm) should work for an easy conversion to HG.

Overall happy, just be aware of the freehub. And if you need to buy the HG hub I still think it is a killer deal for a complete wheelset.
review.name: Looks good so far. NOTICE: XDR freehub

review.reviewBody: My experience mirrors that of the other reviewer. Your scapula will be a-hurting if you choose this pack, so don't choose this pack. It is weirdly badly designed, not like Osprey to make a sucky pack. Absolutely no way to improve the comfort of this pack in the field, because the hard plastic design is what it is--hard and placed exactly where you don't need hard edgy plastic pieces digging into your scapula. Mine were rubbed red and sore. This design flaw makes the pack unusable, but otherwise, it is very nice. I don't even want to donate it to anyone because will just hurt them, too, and why would I pass along something defective to anyone.
review.name: Terrible design, painful and unusable

review.reviewBody: I used the exos on thruhike and was eager to try the eja for a womens specific fit. The shoulder straps and belt fit where a big improvement for me, but there are two flaws that keep me from using this pack. The biggest flaw is the plastic pieces sitting on your scapula. I had abrasions my first time using the pack. The second flaw is the compression straps on the outside of the water bottle compartments. You cannot compress your pack AND get out your bottle while hiking. I'll keep this to loan out since it is adjustable, but already bought another pack for personal use.
review.name: Major flaws with redesign

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Farpoint Wheeled 36L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this but ended up returning for one flaw. On the inside of the bag, the handle housing leaves a huge hump on the inside of the bag where the handle collapses into. So when you're packing the suitcase, you have like deeper spots on the sides and then a huge hump in the middle. It makes it cumbersome and takes up room while packing. I did a mock pack up and had to put shoes on the outsides and then shorts on the middle to avoid the hump. I wish Osprey could make a lay flat handle housing so you would have more room. If it wasn't for this design flaw, it would have been a keeper.
review.name: One Flaw

review.reviewBody: There are very few options for a carry on back pack and this one is just right! I use compression bags as well to really keep my things organized and fit into this so I have no need to check bags any longer. I also really appreciate the strap buckle attachments so I can attach another day pack on the front. Awesome and thank you for this pack!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Purchased from an Osprey dealer. Use for snowboard trips. Have 2 big gear bags to check in and switch to a roller after check in. I've had a few backpack rollers and there needs to be an expectation you will lose a little volume with the backpack feature. Pros: lightweight, storage space is maximized, squared off, robustly built, backpack shoulder strap and belt comfortable and well built, sternum strap, like the frame, easy to roll and pull. There is no laptop sleeve, but look at that as a positive. Last backpack roller, laptop compartment consumed so much volume, had to cut it out. Took on a snowboard trip to Japan and worked great. After past roller backpacks, decided to pay for quality, researched a lot of these. I also bought the Farpoint Travel Daypack to piggy back on if I needed a more volume. Can piggy back or wear, clip onto your chest. Worked out great with my check in luggage overflow. Only con, which is minor, is maybe some external pockets to put small things or documents in. Still a bit fuzzy on the difference between the Farpoint (for men) versus the Fairview (for women) models.
review.name: Versatile carry on

review.reviewBody:
On snowboard trips, I want to wheel my carry-on after checking in my 2 luggage.  Use only once on a snowboard trip to Niseko.  When picking up luggage, go back to backpack mode.  Ditched my Burton wheeled backpack, too small, will clarify.  I did quite  bit of research, not my first wheeled backpack carry-on. Firstly, don't expect a wheeled backpack carry-on to have the same volume as non backpack.  Because of the backpack feature, you will lose a little volume, but there are countermeasures.  Don't get a backpack feature if you are going to complain about volume.  Apparently the Farpoint is for men and Fairview for women.  Confused at first, and can't seem to see any spec differences.  ??  I'd add pics but BC and Osprey pics and vids are really good.

Pro's:
1.  Osprey squared off the bag as much as possible to squeeze out the 36L volume.  There is not a padded slot for a laptop, which is a positive for me, but there is a big zippered mesh pocket on the front.   My last bag had a padded laptop slot which consumed so much volume.  With the robust handle and backpack straps, the volume works for me.  
To give me more volume if needed, I also bought the Farpoint Travel Daypack, got a deal.  15L of more space and marries perfectly with this.  Can be strapped, piggy backed, or it can be clipped onto the shoulder straps and carried on your chest/belly.  The Daypack has a padded slot for hydration or laptop if still looking for a padded laptop slot.
2.  Surprising lightweight yet robustly built.  Aluminum frame gives is great strength.  Tow handle works great.  Sturdy, does not collapse.  Convenient top and side handle.  Big wheels with sealed bearings.
3.  Backpack functions were not skimped on.  Not only shoulder straps, but belt strap as well.  Also has a sternum strap.  Features I was looking for.  When researching, lots of complaints about the wheels making clothes dirty.  The belt acts as a barrier to prevent this.  Backpack straps pack away neatly.  Wearing as a backpack, comfortable and sturdy.  Some products just throw backpack straps on to give it the feature.  
4.  Useful top pocket.  Front mesh pockets, which I haven't used, can't give good feedback whether they hold drinks well.  
5. Infernal compression straps are a good feature.  External straps are really good for attachments, sweater, etc.  
6.  Zipper pulls are nice.

Cons:
1.  A bit pricey, but supposedly manufacturer lifetime warranty.  I'm under the impression Osprey backs there product which helped on the decision.  There are cheaper products out there, but I decided to pay for quality. 
2.  Some side of front zipper pockets would be nice, to slip small items, or documents.  
3.  Got a bit of a price break as a BC member, stock seems low everywhere on this item.  Kinda stalked this. 

Happy with purchase and product, per my explained requirments.
review.name: Great wheeled backpack carry on bag

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight Poly Calf-Length Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of these, having switched to calf length ski baselayers. This is the way. These are a light/midweight option, true to size, and comfortable. Wick well with good light insulation. Kept me warm (but not too warm) in mid-20s weather while skiing, worn under Backcountry Powder Ridge insulated pants. I like that they are made of recycled poly, too! Not a ton of stretch, but I did not feel my movement was restricted at all in these.
review.name: Nice affordable calf-length option!

review.itemreviewed: Lightweight Poly Calf-Length Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are super comfy and I love not having the extra bulk in my boots. Could be a bit more 'elastic' but the fit is pretty true

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my daughter and myself.  I had to return them, the leg area near the knee was very wide and loose , would not have worked out to put ski socks over and then ski pants.
review.name: Wide legs

description: Buy the Black Diamond Orbiter 650 Lantern online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Orbiter 650 Lantern
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Orbiter 650 Lantern online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The orbiter 650 is an overall performer with up to 650 lumens of light and water proof versatility around the campsite. I'll admit that this might be a little large for backpacking, but for everything else it can't be beat. 
The brightness can be be adjusted from a dim companion in your tent up to full brightness. There are a number of settings including colored lights, side and bottom white lights, side only for table top, or bottom only for hanging in your tent from the lantern loop. I've had one out in the rain and it is fully water proof. The battery can also be used to charge cell phones or personal electronics. This is especially helpful for those campsites without power. The fold up legs can be pulled up out of the way for hanging applications, or extended for setting on a picnic table. 
I used to bring a Coleman gas lantern to car camps, but have not used it since getting an Orbiter 650. Everyone comments on how much they like this handy and bright camp lantern.
review.name: Best Camping Lantern

review.reviewBody: I have now had two of their lanterns both are not in a land full. One had poor quality plastic lens that cracked due to quality not poor handling, the other just stopped turning on. All stored with our batteries and low use.
review.name: Not made to last

review.reviewBody: A few days after we purchased this lantern the power went out and I ran to the garage to grab this thong. More than bright enough to light up the whole kitchen and dining room.
review.name: Bright and well built.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this lantern for a mellow raft trip out in the desert to use in our kitchen area. And boy, it is bright! Once we were done with dinners, we turned it to party mode for some nighttime fun. It's really convenient that it can either be hung from a tree or has foldable legs for the tabletop, it's also convenient that it doubles as a charger as well with both USB-A and USB-C ports. It does fit inside a .50 cal ammo can for safe keeping during the day on the river. Definitely recommend this lantern for your next car camping or raft trip.
review.name: Great Lighting for Camp

review.reviewBody: Lots of light settings to fit the camp mood and you can charge your devices while your at it.
review.name: Perfect Camplight

review.reviewBody: A great portable light. Provides great coverage. Only down side is it does need charge regularly
review.name: Big light

review.reviewBody: I bought this product to replace my other black diamond light that died. I charged this for three hours, and it still won’t turn on. I’m beyond frustrated and will not be back to Black diamond products of any kind anytime soon…
review.name: Zero stars if I could

review.reviewBody: Great lantern. Really well engineered and all the features are top notch. I wish it were slightly smaller and lighter, but not a hige deal.
review.name: ORBITER 650 LANTERN

review.reviewBody: I have been using this lantern for about a month and I am very pleased. The light is bright and a single charge lasts a considerable time. I haven't used all the features, such as recharging other devices with it. When it arrives, it may come "locked". Make sure to unlock it first as per the instructions or else it won't turn on when you hit the power button.
review.name: Good Bright Lantern

review.reviewBody: I never got as much support from a company after one of the usb ports unhinged on their lantern. It's a wonderful thing when a company supports it's customers when things go wrong. Thankyou over there!
review.name: Black Diamond for the win!

name: Orbiter 650 Lantern

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Sweepstake Tent Stake - 6-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sweepstake Tent Stake - 6-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Sweepstake Tent Stake - 6-Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the “glow in the dark” feature.  You can actually see the stakes in the dark.  The stakes work well too!
review.name: No more stubbed toes in the dark

review.reviewBody: Works great! Great design and added dirt removal feature.
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for!

review.reviewBody: Very hard to remove from firm ground without breaking off the glow section. Cord rips easily too. For easy terrain only.
review.name: How do you get them out?

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these stakes this summer and have used them extensively over the season.  Summer conditions were relatively mild and I felt I never truly tested them.  In my early use of the stakes, they were primarily used in gravel to loamy soil of the Sierras.  However, this past weekend, I used them to secure my tent for a two night backpacking trip during a massive storm with strong winds.  The stakes held up perfectly.  They were used in hard pack clay soil which turned to a thick muck with the rain.  The stakes held the tent and rain fly without budging.  They were easy to insert into the hard pack ground and, for the second night, thick mud.  The triangular shape held the stakes tight in place. The plastic sweeps were.a huge help in clearing the ridges of the stake of the dirt, mud and debris.  

As strong as the stakes held, they are also incredibly lightweight, making it much easier to carry in my pack.  These are a well designed and thoughtful product.  I highly recommend the product.
review.name: Light weight and sturdy

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a backpacking trip and they were great and durable!! They also glow in the dark too which is a nice feature!
review.name: Awesome lightweight stakes!

review.reviewBody: Purchased these to replace the crappy ones the tent came with. They're lightweight, triangular (sorta) so they don't spin in the ground. The tops also glow in the dark making them easier to see. The slides could go down just a bit farther and a notch towards the top for cordage would be the only improvements I can see so far. Definitely use and enjoy the Sweepstakes
review.name: Multifunctional stakes

review.reviewBody: I picked these up from a local shop to go along with a new tent. They’re definitely a quality price of kit and I’ve never had any issues with them from sandy plaines to the gravel of the Rockies they dig in and hold. Using these for both my footprint and main tent body I rode out a wind storm with 65+ winds with ZERO problem. Oh and I was in a different tent with only my sleeping pad/bag in my own and it held perfectly. It still baffles me how well this gear worked... One time buy, you won’t regret.
review.name: Quality Lightweight stake!

review.reviewBody: Keeps our victory blanket from blowing away at the beach! Awesome!
review.name: Great for our victory blanket

name: Sweepstake Tent Stake - 6-Pack

review.itemreviewed: Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Shell Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had been interested in trying out bib ski pants so went with these.  The height was a bit weird- definitely just a tall pant vs a Bib - but I kept them as I figured I got a deal and would be worth it to try out the trend /they were a lot cheaper than other bib pants.  They’re awful.  Not waterproof at all, even on the first wear, and do not keep me warm.  These were also my first Helly Hansen purchase, and will be my last.
review.name: Not waterproof at all and weird height

review.itemreviewed: Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Shell Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I'm from Southeast Alaska, and we basically live in Helly Hansen rain gear. I was excited to try these bibs because HH is such a reliable brand, but was disappointed. Here's why:
-Not very waterproof out of the box, even in light to moderate moisture. My legs and butt were soaked after a 3 hour ski day in wetter snow. 
-Fit is weird. Fine through the waist and lower legs, but the hips and upper thighs are super wide, giving you that Oompa Loompa look. 
-Straps are garbage. They don't stay cinched in place, so they're constantly slipping off the shoulder and need readjustment every few hours. 

A few pros:
-Easy to move and tour in. Also easy to pee in. 
-Great breathability (probably because they're not very waterproof...)
-Pockets are awesome. Big enough for a beacon and to store other bits and bobs.

If you're in a drier climate, these will work fine. Overall though, the surprising lack of decent waterproofing and attention to detail (especially with the straps) is not worth the price. Sigh...
review.name: Sadly, a letdown

name: Odin Mountain Infinity 3L Shell Bib Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Dirty/Clean 10L Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dirty/Clean 10L Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Dirty/Clean 10L Bag online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This bag is perfect for travelling on my bike but now I also use if for most of my weekend travels. It's fantastic and roomy and better yet the separate compartments for clean/dirty clothes is a game changer: keeps clean, fresh clothes separated from dirty smelly clothes.
review.name: Works and I'll never go back

review.reviewBody: I sweat daily when I exercise at the gym or play pickleball. I store my wet clothes in the "Wash Me" and take them home, but the sweat doesn't soak into the "Wear Me" and when I get home, I turn the "Wash Me" inside out and hang them out to dry so that I can use it cleanly and without it getting smelly. I like it because it's easy to take in and out even when I put it in a big gym bag.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Used this bag for a couple nights in Joshua Tree and it worked well. Split the dirty from the clean and my clothes didn't stink. Beats bringing two dry sacks.
review.name: Really great bag for travelling and camping

review.reviewBody: I've used this bag a few times now and I love the simplicity - undergarments and socks fill it up, and make their way to the dirty side afterwards. Works like it should, by the time I get home the Clean Me side is full.
review.name: One of my travel favorites

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for travel to use as a makeshift laundry bag. Like that my dirties won't touch my cleanies.
review.name: I love this bag

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) This isn't the lightest compression sac, but it is very helpful to not only separate clean/dirty gear, but also to separate wet/dry gear if you don't have time to dry it out before stuffing it into your pack. I use mine to separate a wet tent fly from the body after a rainy night.
review.name: Worth the extra weight

review.reviewBody: Have not used it in the field yet. However, I am looking forward to the opportunity, It has a barrier that allows the full use of the space inside as well as keep funky items contacting the clean ones. In theory, it should also help to restrain my over packing.
review.name: Great idea.

review.reviewBody: It works just as I expected it to. It was very nice to have the separation between clean and dirty clothes. I even used the dirty side to hold a pair of sandy water shoes while keeping clean clothes separated. Nice design. Well made.
review.name: Works as expected - great

review.reviewBody: I used this stuff bag on a recent military training exercise where we spent 21 straight days living out of our ruck sack in the woods. I bought this dry/clean bag before I left as an afterthought addition on another purchase and thought it would be more of a novelty. During the time in the woods I got really bad poison ivy on my arms. I was able to use this bag to separate my clothes that had the poison ivy oil on them and keep clean clothes on the other side. When I bought this I thought the separation would just be a nice to have for smell but it actually really came in handy. The construction of the bag is solid and exactly what you would expect from OR. You can roll the sides to compress the items in it if needed. It also kept all my clothes dry when my rucksack got soaked. This bag definitely has a place on multi-week trips or even just traveling when you want to be able to separate the cleans from the dirties when you are on vacation.
review.name: Separate sides is more than just a novelty

review.reviewBody: This bag kept my clean and dirty clothes separated really well. I ended up in a lake with my clothes on and put those wet clothes straight into the dirty section of this bag. I thought for sure the water would seep into the clean clothes section, but to my delight my clean clothes stayed dry! Super impressed. The only thing I wish for is for some way to identify the clean and dirty ends quickly especially when you are fumbling in the dark with a flashlight. Maybe have the wash me/wear me labels on the outer part of the bag as opposed to on the folded up part of the bag or maybe have a dual coloured bag where one end is dark red and the other end is light red
review.name: Love this bag

name: Dirty/Clean 10L Bag

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this and love it ! It’s so hard when you have wide feet to find wide boots.  I love the fit and color.  Comfortable for every day wear.
review.name: Wide Yay!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great quality all around. These are wider than regular but not quite as wide as purchasing a W. Run true to size but just a little small. I wear a 9 1/2 W or 10. Buy 1/2 size up to allow for socks. I love all the available colors.
review.name: high quality, look great!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these for a trip where I would be doing some hiking and a lot of walking. Good quality and comfortable.
review.name: Hiking Boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm currently breaking these guys in but they are very comfortable.
review.name: Super Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I did order a size up because I wanted extra room for thick socks. I was surprised at how comfortable these are since I've been disappointed in the past with more expensive boots. It's hard to find a "wide" in boots as well. The craftmanship is excellent; I'm very pleased.
review.name: Comfort and great value!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the most comfortable boot ever. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because this version has a non leather upper. Kinda tacky and also more sweaty. There's a different version that has a leather upper.
review.name: Really good boot for someone with wide feet.

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the most comfortable and stable hiking boots I’ve ever purchased, and they are extremely stylish too!  I wore them for several hikes in CO in mountainous, rocky, uneven terrain — they required absolutely no break-in and were comfortable from the first time I stepped into them.  They provided excellent support and cushioning, and are water proof!  The teal detailing makes me feel fashionable, especially when I wear coordinating leggings.  These are a 10+ and I highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable from first step, great for wide feet

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I work for USPS and walk 4-8 miles a day. I was worried the first day I wore these and had my old ones on deck to change but it was not necessary. Straight out of the box these were great all day. No blisters, great fit. Very comfortable sole and my wide foot was perfectly cradled in the wide fit. Great shoe, good price, excellent value.
review.name: Comfy right out of box

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Wide Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The website was uncomplicated, and it was easy to find my desired category to make my purchase.
The boots are comfortable. I've had a few pairs and I never get blisters from them. They are durable and fit my lifestyle.
They are designed a little more narrow, otherwise, they fit just right.

review.name: Long Lasting

review.reviewBody: We bought this stroller when our first grandson was born knowing he was visiting at Christmas. We live in Telluride, CO. This is a must for walking around on our snowy streets. Will be great in summer too as we have a lot of rugged terrain. Our son & daughter in law love using it and want to get one for San Francisco where they live. Sure easy to set up and great quality.
review.name: Must have stroller in a mountain town!

review.reviewBody:
We’ve been using the Urban Glide 3 (with and without the bassinet) since May, and we absolutely love it! Living in a city condo with limited space, it’s amazing to have an all-terrain stroller that handles city life effortlessly—even after a snowstorm—while also being perfect for outdoor adventures in the summer and fall. It performed well on trails with our 6-month-old. I deducted one star because I couldn’t give 4 1/2. The only downside is the handle when folded. If you have space to store it flat or on its side, it’s not an issue. But for us, with only a wardrobe to store it folded and standing, you need to fold the handle, which does lock in that position and triggers the brake. It would be great if the handle could fold and lock without activating the brake.
But overall we have absolutely no regrets!
review.name: Great stroller!

review.reviewBody: We purchased this along with the bassinet attachment. It’s so nice having, essentially, two beds for our baby: her bassinet attachment that we can easily move around the house and her regular crib. The stroller is sleek, easy to close and rides very smoothly! Large storage basket as well. We get so many compliments since it’s such a unique style and design. We love it. With the bassinet attachment, it is pretty large but we don’t mind at all - just something to keep in mind.
review.name: Excellent, high quality. No complaints!

review.reviewBody: After extensive research on what i like to call "off roading strollers" we choose the Thule Urban Glide 3. I am very happy with it so far, its nice and light weight, love the zippered pocket at the bottom and have been very happy with how it handles.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Bought this stroller for my daughter, having her baby any day! She wanted an all-terrain  stroller that will go anywhere...she researched it and it was on the top 10 list. She also purchased the bassinet separately that you can switch out. It's very well made and worth the price!!
review.name: Perfect stroller

review.reviewBody: We bought this and the newborn insert for our 2 month old that hated the bassinet. Adjustable recline angle is a great feature. Smooth ride over the rough roads by our house. She hated it the first few times, but came around and now loves long walks. Does take up a lot of space, but easy to fold up. Sun shade is great. Can’t wait to try out running in a few months.
review.name: Solid Stroller

review.reviewBody: Purchased Glade 3 for our Daughter's newborn.  I must say the Glide has proven to be an excellent product.  Good construction, and easy to assemble (maybe 15 minutes).  An added benefit - EXERCISE!  Thank you.
review.name: Glide 3

review.reviewBody: This stroller is amazing!! I am so excited to use it as a first time mom for years to come. It is robust, adaptable, easily collapses, and will be perfect for trail walks and runs. I purchased the bassinet and car seat adapters and they work fantastic, this stroller will easily be a staple in our home!
review.name: Strong and adaptable

review.reviewBody: My baby is now 8 months and I’ve been trying to get back pre baby body . I’ve been shopping around for a jogging stroller for quite awhile. I really liked the features of the Thule Urban Glide 3 such as: seat harness, reclining seat, stroller shade, the under carriage storage, and the plastic window(for viewing baby). The wheels are great for all terrain, making this stroller easy to glide. Another feature I liked was the easy folding feature. The stroller is a bit heavy, but given the durability and sturdiness, I’m happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great Stroller

review.reviewBody:
This stroller is amazing. Easy to assemble easy to take down and up easy to store and the quality is amazing

Aesthetically pleasing of course.

It handles all types of terrains

I also have a Nuna but this stroller blows it out of the water!!! Even for everyday use the Glide just give my baby an amazing smooth ride! The shocks offer so much support when walking or jogging!!! This bad boy even handles theirs well (at a slow pace of course) 

The space it has is great as well! It has the bottom storage and rear of the seat!!! 

The sun shade on the glide is perfect!!! You can pull it all the way down and still keep an eye on your little with a mesh option or the see through plastic option

Also running is a breeze with this stroller. Which is the real reason I bought it but it has become my everyday stroller now!!!

This stroller truly is worth the $$$
review.name: Best stroller

name: Chariot Urban Glide 3 Stroller

review.reviewBody: Super uncomfortable. I’m athletic and this fit everywhere except the armpits and across the shoulders. Scratchy material but to be expected with wool. Otherwise beautiful sweater. Tried to use discount multiple times with Id.me, code wouldn’t work I think maybe because product was already marked down? Don’t know , now I’m stuck where I can’t use discount, if I go to Id.me to generate a new code it says I need to use the previously issued code that wasn’t use, if I try to use previous code, Backcountry says code already used. I returned the sweater and used PayPal and never received anything from PayPal that backcountry initiated the refund (PayPal in the past with other companies has always processed returns immediately.) it’s been 5 days, tried to chat with someone, it wouldn’t connect me with a person…they don’t give you details when return is complete. Just says return is complete and doesn’t tell you to expect refund or store credit or you’re sol or anything. Not a very good experience shopping this website.
review.name: Fit weird, bad return experience

review.reviewBody: I bought this sweater less than three months ago and there is already a hole under the left arm. This is my third sweater from here. The first one (on right side of picture) i ordered about five years ago and i was VERY happy with it. Im willing to pay for quality but i rodered one last year and after a few months a hole started under the arm. I chalked it up as maybe needing a bigger size. Even though it fits perfect and there’s a but of stretch to it.  So this year i ordered a size bigger. Its a bit baggy but i wear it prediminantly for warmth not fashion.  Sure enough, a hole starts under the arm, less than three months in. Im very disappointed. The knit quality seems to be declining and sadly i can’t afford to take any chances to pay this kind of money for a sweater that only lasts a few wears.
review.name: Declining knit quality

review.reviewBody: I bought this less than three minths ago and i’ve worn it a handful or times and theres already a small hole starting under the arm where all the seams meet.   This happened with my last one too but not as quickly so I thiught maybe i should have ordered a sixe bigger and maybe it was a big too small and was pulling. So  this year I ordered a size bigger. Even thiugh i’ve even lost a few poinds. Now its loose abd STILL a hole. Inpulled out a third one that I bought a few years ago and the knit wuality is like night and day. Yes that one has worn down under the arms too. Not sure why only there (probably the wool on the arms rubbing when they move) but that first. Sweater lasted me probably five years before it got so worn that I couldnt wear it. Seeater #2 from last year lasted me one season and this one got a hole started in less than wears.  Pretty frustrating because I am wilking to PAY for QUALITY and i love these sweaters but sadly I’m not able to spemd that kind of money again for only a few wears.
review.name: Descreasing quality

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'9, 155lb, frequent crossfit. I ordered a medium based on the size chart, the fit was terrible for my body type, elbow pads were far to high, no space for shoulders :( if you have any type of muscle, I would pass... 
I love the design so much and hope they are able to be inclusive of a more active body someday.
I have loved this company in the past.
review.name: Won't fit athletic/tall body type

review.reviewBody: I bought this sweater in Arctic Green size XL. It was true to size and so beautiful. I got compliments on it the first time I wore it. It is a little itchy but works well with a long sleeve shirt beneath it.
review.name: Lovely

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, great quality, colors are exactly as depicted in pictures. I will be back for more!
review.name: Beautiful sweater!

review.reviewBody: High quality, beautiful sweater. Only complaint is it's definitely scratchy - needed to wear a shirt underneath. Does run slightly large - I ordered the small (usually size 4 / 34C chest) and it fit but was roomy, size down if you want a slimmer fit.
review.name: Beautiful but itchy

review.reviewBody: This is such a cute sweater!  I love the bit of brown on the elbows. It fits great, is very comfy, and is super stylish.
review.name: So cute!

review.reviewBody: Excellent customer service and fast shipping. Lovely sweater.
review.name: Lovely sweater

review.reviewBody: Just want I was looking for during our "work from home winter"  -- classic fair isle styling, cozy and warm, and looks great on a Zoom call. I'm 5'5" 120 lbs and returned the small for an xs to fit like the photo in Dark Navy.  The small fit like a cozy sweatshirt; xs is a little more tailored but not tight. Not itchy worn over a thin long sleeve tee.
review.name: Classic, cozy and warm

name: Ovik Knit Sweater - Women's

review.reviewBody: One of the primary reasons I gave the SlimShady a 5 star review is because of the simplicity to attach and remove the shade to my Yakima Overhaul HD rack system on my Tundra. I don't need the shade every week and don't see the point of driving around with an awning around the city. I can attach it in a few minutes and detach just as quickly with the easy clamp system. It also withstood strong winds, but I will say that it required two people to set it up in the high wind.It is a durable and well-main product too.
review.name: Simple attachment

review.reviewBody: Easily one of the best additions to my crosstrek. Easy to set up, took less then 5 minutes.
review.name: Perfect shade

review.reviewBody: I love these comfy shorts! They dry quickly and have so many pockets!!!
review.name: Fab shorts!

review.reviewBody: I struggled to find hiking shorts for women that were roomy enough for a lot of movement but also durable and quick drying. These are great, they ran a bit big on me but I like the extra room in the hips and legs. The drawstring is great to keep them in place. I purchased a L and am 5’10 150lbs.
review.name: Vibrant and fun hiking shorts

review.reviewBody: Love the shorts although they run a bit large. I always wear a size small and that's what I ordered, but there's quite a big gap in the waist. They're loose, even when tied.
review.name: Cute but run big!

review.reviewBody: Amazing shorts that have now become my new favorite in my rotation! They are long enough to be super comfortable for long hikes and walks while still looking cute! The pockets are big and the back pocket is perfect for little items. I’m going back to get 3 more pairs before my hiking trip next month.
review.name: Cotopaxi Brinco Short

review.reviewBody: Great quality pair of shorts, love the color and the functional pockets. My only comment is the drawstring is a tad short to tie comfortably, but I've been living in these shorts and thinking of buying a 2nd pair!
review.name: Just the pair I was looking for

review.reviewBody: Got these for an upcoming Hawaii trip and they are quick dry and cute! The blue and pink colors are so cute. Did a huge hike in really hot weather in them and was Cindy the whole time!
review.name: Cute river shorts

name: Brinco Solid Short - Women's

review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My current apex jacket has lasted since 2008, and I still love everything about it! The cuffs are finally starting to look a little worn so buying another...
review.name: Going on 15 years!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is by far my favorite jacket that TNF makes!
review.name: I love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased as a replacement for an older verison of the women's Apex Bionic. Disappointed in the updates. review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket. Exactly what I have been looking for! Tired of fleece jackets that my hair and dogs stick to. This jacket is multifunctional for walking, hiking, a day out, it's great for everything. Fit is almost tailored, looks beautiful on.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit - roomy and comfortable - great for everyday use!
review.name: Comfortable Shirt

review.reviewBody: I love crop tops and they seem to be hard to find.  This top is perfect.  It is a nice light material but not too thin, and the crop length is not too short  but not too long.  I find it runs big.  I am 5'6", 125lbs, 34C.  More often than not I wear a medium but the small in this is loose and the perfect size.  The green is a nice color.  I also ordered the white.  Very pleased.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Love a boxy cropped tee for the bike and this shirt hits the spot. Light and comfy. Wish the sewing on the folded sleeves was a bit more solid (they flop around a bit) but otherwise it's perfect
review.name: Cute and comfy

review.reviewBody: Super cute crop tee that's not too short, quick dry, and flattering. I have one each in green and black, love! I'm about 5'7", 133#, fairly broad shoulders, and am happy with size S. I'm normally a S or M in tops and bottoms.
review.name: Very comfortable, stylish, functional

review.reviewBody: I like the smooth, comfortable feel and flowy style of this shirt. I got the black and the lighter sage green, both are awesome. It's not too short, but does show a little belly if you lift your hands above your head, which I think you should expect with a crop shirt. I'm about 5'7" and 133# and a size S was perfect. I tend to size down in a lot of OR clothing, though.
review.name: Comfortable, cute, flattering!

review.reviewBody: This shirt is amazing. Even though the UPF is only 30, you can tell it's a high quality sun shirt that is going to protect from the sun! I loooove the purple color, AND I had to buy myself a second shirt in black!
review.name: SO CUTE

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the crop style and the material is perfect. fit is great!
review.name: Love this shirt!

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) This fit exactly as I hoped it would. It is very soft and drapes nicely. True to size and very flattering.
review.name: So soft!

review.reviewBody: Great hiking t-shirt for us shorter bodied ladies. I find that alot of athletic tees are too long on me, but the crop length on this is the perfect fit. The material is also so soft and comfy Love it!. 5"3, 125 lbs and got size XS.
review.name: Love this!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super cute and comfortable. Flattering for those with shorter torsos.
review.name: Flattering fit!

name: Essential Boxy T-Shirt - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Looks good, nice material though the zipper is kind of chunky. Runs absolutely huge around the stomach. Fits me in the shoulders and neck and flaps around down low. Have to return it unfortunately.
review.name: Fits WAY big

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Light wieght comfortable and great fit excellent quality
review.name: Castelli jersey

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have an Entrata III size M from a few years ago - love it, and it fits perfectly.  i'm 5'8" 165lb.  The size chart says I should get Large - which is definitely not right and the other reviews helpfully say this runs big.  So I got a medium - should be good, right?  the old one fit and it was medium, and i'm sizing down from the fit chart as the comments say.    Well, it almost fits - the sleeves are just right but the torso is too long, and the collar and chest are a bit loose.  

size down by 2 sizes.  Competitive Cyclist should customize the charts for each individual garment.

I'd return it but I went ahead and wore it because I thought I could make it work.  I guess i'll just stick to in-person shops.
review.name: WARNING : WAY too big, fit has changed

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have bought the same Entrata jersey in gray and blue and they have been consistent, with nice black rubber band inside bottom perimeter for secure fit. However my recent purchase in Defender Green was not made with the black rubber inside band, fit was different, loose, lower quality, returned item.
review.name: The Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 5'10" at 185lbs and I started with a XL since the Castelli size chart says that's the size I should be in. It was to big all around, so I sent it back and ordered a Large. Liked the fit around my arms and shoulders but found for a Large it was very loose around my gut, lower back and mid chest. By that time the color I liked was already sold out of the medium so I hung on to it. Really wish I didn't because its just a little to loose for my taste and compared to my other Castelli jerseys I have it is off on the sizing. Also I would like to add that Competitive Cyclist/ Backcountry should have a better return policy like a fit guarantee and one free return shipping both ways to help the consumer because the sizing for cycling clothing is very versatile and can fit differently for every person.
review.name: Nice Jersey, but sizing runs big.

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'd bought a couple of these hoping they'd fit as well as previous versions of these I own, but found out on trying them on they're a bit sloppier in the waist area and moved about too much to be something I'd want to wear while out on a lengthy road bike ride, because it was obvious the front would ride up quickly and drive me nuts. Material feels like it would be great for breathability and the rest of the fit was the usual Castelli trim but not overly restrictive fit. Sizing is Castelli's usual overly small system, at 6'3" and a 44" inch chest I had to buy a XXL.
review.name: Decent jersey, doesn't fit as well

review.itemreviewed: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jersey breaths well and I like the reflective material, rear pockets and the arm compression cuffs hold the jersey in place without being restrictive.  I wear an XL in most Castelli jerseys and this is no exception.  I like my jerseys to fit snug but not a compression type fit.
review.name: Wicks Moisture Well

name: Entrata VI Limited Edition Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.name: Sense Pro 5 Set Vest - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Sense Pro 5 Set Vest - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The instructional video shows it's able to hold poles at the back but the women's version is different, it doesn't have the same pole loops.  Fit small even though I followed the size guide, inner material is scratchy.
review.name: Prefer Other Salomon Vests
comment: Hi, thank you for leaving this comment. We’re happy to know that our team is handling your case right now, please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: This is everything I hoped for and more. Love the tiffany blue color.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: i took this on my long run, i was expecting it to be better than my skin 8. i have a skin 8 and it is good, didnt rub on my neck. i was expecting this sense pro would be better as you know, its called 'PRO'? but it is not as good as skin 8. i am dissappointed. apart from that, the measurement is off, i dont look like the model in the product images, it was huge on me! my chest measurement is 34, i thought S would be perfect but it is not. it's as if i am wearing my husband's vest
review.name: measurements are off, chafing on my neck
comment: Hello! Thank you very much for your comment. A member of our team will contact you shortly to talk about your experience.

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed. I wanted to love this vest but let me down after two runs. Now the Flask Tube bounces around while running. Very annoying…
review.name: Ripped after two runs- poor design
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I am so glad that I bought this hydration vest. It is so light and comfortable that I completely forget I am wearing it. I love the practical soft water bottles and the straws are the perfect length to sip water whilst running. Lots of practical pockets. Washes really well. This has transformed my long runs, wish I had bought it sooner.
review.name: Perfect hydration vest

review.reviewBody: The Sense Pro 5 vest fits perfectly and is nice and lightweight. Has many pockets and I like that it holds two smaller bladders instead of one. Highly recommend!
review.name: Lightweight and fits perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought this vest to wear on long runs for marathon training. It is comfortable for 20-mile runs and does not move. It is also light which is nice in the heat. There is plenty of easily accessible storage without feeling bulky. The vest does not chafe when I wear tank tops but I would recommend wearing it with a higher-necked top otherwise it would rub my collarbone. I ordered the vest in the blue color which does get salt stains but they are easily fixed when wiped down. The water bottles are great and don't bounce or rub against my arms. The straws were a little difficult to remove from the base in order to cut them but it worked better with boiling water.
review.name: Great Vest

review.reviewBody:
I am sure many runners can relate. We spend hundreds of dollars on various running contraptions that hold our water, food and phones, but we are never quite happy with them. They bounce, chafe, hurt our shoulders, make us overheat, bruise our hips, and more. So we move onto the next best thing (spending even more money) hoping that it will be marginally better. 

And then comes along the sense pro vest. I have two of these so I can promise, the purchase is worth it. This vest is soft (no chaffing), fits snugly (adjustable clips and elastic band that can be adjusted while running/consuming the water - so no bounce), it distributes weight nicely (no sore shoulders), it is thin (no overheating) and it has pockets galore (that are easy to access even when the vest is on). 

I have the women's version and the unisex version. I would recommend the women's version only because the water bottles are shaped differently and curve around boobs nicer than the unisex bottles. 

My only suggestion to change the product would be to make the straws easier to adjust. It took me longer than I would like to admit (and a few youtube videos) to get them off, cut them and get them back on.
review.name: Best vest ever!

review.reviewBody: First its so hard to cut the straws, a little warm water doesnt do it. Second the fit just doesnt feel right and cuts into the back of my neck, for the price i shouldn't be worrying about chaffing etc. I order the large and im a 34c and its snug, so thats doesnt say much for the size range. I love the fabric it's made of i wish that was touching my neck instead of the mesh backing. There is know was i can where a tank top with this back, Id go through so much nut butter and kt tape. My advance skin fits much larger and rubs less but that fell apart week 1.:/
review.name: Could be amazing
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
Let’s start with the good. Love the female fit, flasks are quite comfortable and I’m a medium chested gal. The tubes on the flasks can be shortened and I actually quite enjoyed them with shortened tubes. Very comfy vest and lightweight. I did notice the bit of chafing some others mention here, but I always wear tshirts/higher necklines when I run so it wasn’t a big deal for me. 
Now for my biggest issue….My first salomon pack lasted me years before showing signs of wear and tear. I bought this pack for an ultra race a couple weeks ago. Wore it a couple times for training and no problem. Beautiful. Wore it for my race shortly after, and somehow it tore! Multiple places I might add, one being on the back mesh panel which makes no sense to me since everything inside was stored in a dry bag. I didn’t take any falls nor did I do any bushwhacking where a tree could have snagged it. When I pay this much for a pack, I expect the integrity of it to last me at least a few good years. This has left me entirely disappointed since I really do love the pack but I’m afraid to wear it and if I do actually run into anything it’ll fall apart and not last. Maybe a malfunction? Not sure.
review.name: Love it but…..

name: Sense Pro 5 Set Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: I can’t say enough good things about these bibs. They give you all the benefits of pants and all the benefits of bibs. The detachable top makes bathroom breaks so easy but also gives extra warmth up top. The gortex keeps me warm and dry. I’ve worn these for two seasons and they’ve help up wonderfully. I’m normally a small but I did order a medium to get a baggier look but I’d say they do fit true to size
review.name: Best Bibs out there

review.reviewBody: Great bibs! Fit is great and easily adjustable. Zippers are conveniently located to make it easier to use the bathroom without having to take off all my layers. Pockets are big, used the thigh pocket for the phone.
review.name: Great Bibs

review.reviewBody:
Bought these used em in solid PNW conditions they worked great
Definitely have the right layers underneath and with these you are dialed. Windproof, waterproof, stays warm doesn’t rub anywhere , no signs of anything wrong this far !
review.name: Rad pant good overall performance

review.reviewBody: I thought the option to have bibs or no bibs would be great however the no bibs option was strange around the waist. 5’8 150
review.name: Odd fit

review.reviewBody: Another killer product from the minds at backcountry.  These bibs are BURLY! very tough fabric that might feel a little stiff.heavy to some, so beware.  Comparable to the Arc-teryx 3L ski fabrics.  BIG NOTE: these are a full size bigger than the previous iteration.  Literally went from a medium to a small and they fit exactly the same. The upper "bib bra" is much higher than the previous version, so maybe a little stuffier, but also more storage....for snacks.  The fit is great, moves with you.  The "zipper highway" at the waist is opposite the previous version, so if you had any bright ideas about interoperability, it's a no-go. Overall, a killer set of bibs that will probably hold up for years.
review.name: Backcountry Wins Again

review.reviewBody: Great shell bibs with plenty of features including ability to remove bib and wear as pants. Not form fitting but still cute. Runs large - I was planning to get a medium for room but after reading reviews went with the small and glad I did. I’m 5’7” and 130lbs.
review.name: Warm and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have never worn bibs until now.  These have made me a convert.  They were warmer, kept me dry(no snow up the back wiggling around in deep snow when I fell) and more comfortable.  Going to the bathroom was harder but there are lots of different zippers to accommodate this.  I preferred the side zip but others may have been willing to use the waist zips.  The sizing is generous to allow layering and ease of movement.  I highly recommend.  I purchased an xl and feel the sizing guide was spot on.  The bibs are a gore laminate so no moisture issues and the fabric seems more durable being a resilient texture.
review.name: Bibs are awesome!

review.reviewBody: I've boarded in these 3 times so far and they've kept me cozy and dry. No wet butt! I think they run a bit big, but I would rather have extra room flexibility snowboarding. Happy with all the pockets and zippered back panel for easy trips to the loo. I don't think I will ever wear them as pants. I don't think they'd velcro enough to stay up. Bibs are best anyways.
review.name: Love my bibs

review.reviewBody: Quality bibs for price. Form fitting but still roomy for underlayers. The waist zipper for bathroom break is a great feature.
review.name: Great snow bibs

review.reviewBody: These are so awkward and wide in the hips. They also just feel horrible like they wouldn't be comfortable to wear all day.
review.name: SO wide in hips

name: Cottonwoods GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
