review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this shirt.  It looks so good in the photos.  The shirt is well made.  It.is.HUGE - so huge and boxy.  It is a box shape.  I cannot imagine how it would look good on anyone.  It would take a number of washings to get close to soft and flexible.  It actually seems well made, the snaps are a nice touch.  The 'lace' is rough and really doesn't look good in person.  I'm barely 5'3 so maybe on someone taller it might be better?  I wanted to love it.  I am not sure even an XS would have fit.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The most comfortable Gore-tex boot I ever wore. I work in a logistics plant & we are on our feet most of our shift. Great for the current cold weather. Definitely a great purchase.
review.name: Comfort 24/7

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoe looks great and is very comfortable, however it is not very rugged and not intended for major trail/hiking use. I purchased this shoe to try out and perhaps switch over from my Keen Hiking boots.  This shoe did not come close to comparing.  Its nice to use around the house and maybe take to the park, but not for extreme outdoor activities.
review.name: Shoe quality.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoe looks nice, and feels and appears to be of decent quality. However, there is a design flaw. Where the gusset of the tongue is stitched to join the body of the shoe, it forms a very hard spot on the upper inside, causing the corner of the tongue to dig into the foot. Both right and left shoes had the same issue in the same spot.
review.name: Extremely uncomfortable

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Eeveryone complains that the shoes are too tight, that they are bad, etc. These are the best shoes I have ever had for everyday use in cold and wet weather.
the first day when I put them on, they were a little tight, but a couple of days later when I put them on for the second time they fit perfectly, thin or thick socks they are ideal, light and soft when walking on asphalt or trekking.
review.name: good shoes for everyday or trekking

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Comfortable and waterproof...5th pair of this model purchased for family.
Has Gore Tex lining and Vibram outsole for durability
review.name: Comfortable and waterproof at a great price

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great for hiking, & just for kicking around-love them.
I appreciated the heads up from a previous reviewer informing that these run a half size small. I typically wear a size 10, so ordered 10 1/2’s- perfect fit!
review.name: Perfect for hiking/walking.

review.name: I'm going out to not sure what you need?

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fitting trail sneaker You stay comfortable all day.But the soft rubber on the heel of sneaker chips easily while walking in the woods and leaves holes..
review.name: Rubber heel Review

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Hierro Mid Extra Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hello, thank you for asking me to review these shoes which became very painful to wear after doing so for more than 2 hours.  I would like to return these shoes since I cannot wear them.  I have only worn them around the house, so they are ln like new condition.  Can you please send me return label
review.name: Do not have enough support like other New Balance

description: Buy the Burley Baby Seat Insert online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Baby Seat Insert
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Baby Seat Insert online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Our 10lb newborn loves it! She is very comfortable and it’s so nice to be able to know she’s secure and content. 

Things I don’t like: 

It was VERY difficult to install. 
Horrible directions! 
The Cub does not collapse very flat for transport in the car with the baby insert in place. 
Our newborn’s toes stick out the end. It is not long enough or does not fit properly in the stroller. 
It’s quite large. It would be nice if it was a little smaller and fit tighter in the Cub.
review.name: 50% satisfied

review.reviewBody: Supports my 1 month old’s head well and he enjoys riding in it. Fairly easy to install, removing it is a bit more cumbersome. Works well overall. The minor cons are that it could use a chest clip, and my babies feet stick out in the mesh of the wind screen. We use it to walk on paved roads and sidewalks (sometimes even attached to a bike even though we know we shouldn’t- we go slow)
review.name: Works!

review.reviewBody:
Burley cart baby seat “works”…

But baby is basically hanging out of it. She’s too far out, so sunshield and wind shield can’t be utilized on walks. And sometimes she starts to slide out.

The Thule baby sling is a better design.
review.name: Afterthought design

review.reviewBody: Bought the double stroller with the new baby seat insert for my 3yr old and newborn (now 8wks old). It's hit or miss if she's content. For context, she's a very happy baby, approx. 13lbs at this point. Loves the car seat and is a great traveler. Not sure if it's the shoulder straps that are bugging her, but she doesn't last very long in the insert. If I go more than 1.5miles (30mins), the walk typically ends in her crying. Maybe she'll like it more when she's a little bigger 🤷‍♀️
review.name: Was hoping for a little more

name: Baby Seat Insert

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hestra Patrol Gauntlet Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: True to size. This glove does not keep your hands warm at all. Your fingertips will be cold even at 30°. Don’t even try and take these gloves out in subzero weather. You will last about two minutes before their fingertips are frozen.
review.name: Horrible glove

review.reviewBody: Bought these in January 2021 and wore them maybe a dozen times for skiing . I ski at a resort as well as in the backcountry and need reliable gloves. My hands were wet and cold every time . I used wax and waterproofing spray as well and they were still garbage. I contacted Hestra directly and they told me my cold hands were my problem and wouldn’t warranty them.  They also now look like they are three years old rather than a few months old. Awful brand I won’t buy again.
review.name: Garbage
comment:
Hi Audrey, I am sorry to hear about your experience with this item. If you would like some help in finding some gloves to replace this pair, we would be happy to help. Contact us via chat/phone/email and we can further help with this. 

Thanks!

name: Patrol Gauntlet Glove - Women's

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I cannot say enough about this boot. So happy they make a wide now as I’ve worn oversized Salomon for years but bought sized up. Now, with the wide it’s a perfect boot. I have worn Salomon’s on tour in Iraq as a light infantrymen, and I’ve worn them over the years for hiking and even just everyday wears. They are just top notch. Please Salomon, make the green/kelp color pattern in wide too!!! I would immediately buy another pair. And thank you for making the wide!!!!
review.name: Absolutely Best Shoe Ever

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: New to these, but so far they are great! Very comfortable and grippy in the snow. If anything changes, I'll update this review.
review.name: Great looking, comfortable and great grip.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have purchased this specific hiking boot continuously for the last five years, since before covid 19. These are stable flexible rugged and waterproof. They have good arch supports. I wear them walking around construction sites and in the bottom of water reservoirs for hours. I definitely recommend them.
review.name: Awesome hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are the lightest boots I have owned. As yet I have not been on a long walk however I’m sure they will be up for the task.
review.name: Featherweight footwear

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The X ULTRA 4 MID WIDE GORE-TEX is the narrowest fitting 'wide fit' I've come across.  I was delighted to find that Salomon  made a wide fit version, I wanted a new lightweight boot but can't wear the usual standard fit. Unfortunately, having tried to wear them 3 times for my 7 - 10 mile walks, I've limped painfully home each time.  There's not sufficient width in the toe box for my foot.
The boots look great, I love the lightness, there's no fault on them, and I'd love to use them. They're just not as wide as the 'wide fit' boots they would have replaced and too painful to wear.
review.name: Great if you've got narrow feet
comment:
Thank you very much for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are sorry to hear that the fit ultimately wasn´t quite right for you. We are constantly striving to ensure our wider fitting models are as accessible as possible to all of our clients.

Your review will be passed to our quality department immediately.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: the shoes are incredibly comfortable and perform very well. used them for long hikes 30km+ and my feet did not hurt.
review.name: very comfortable and stable shoes

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the second year that I have hiked in the Andes mountains with these X Ultra 04 boots. I have always liked the Salomon brand, but now that opinion is solidified. The ankle support saved me more than once, and the durability on that rough terrain is impressive. And yet still comfortable enough to wear around town. These are my favorite hiking boots so far. Way to go Salomon.
review.name: Tested and Proven

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: A number of years ago, while I was still working (since retired) I bought a pair of insulated boots for work.  They were the best boots I ever owned.  I was looking for another pair, as after about 15 years, these had started to leak and they no longer kept my feet as warm.  I have a very wide foot, and couldn't find any on the website, so chatted online, who directed me to these.  While not insulated, I'm using them for a different purpose, working around my hobby farm and they are very comfortable. lightweight with great traction.  No need to break in Solomon's they are great right out of the box.  I just wish they had more wide versions.  I'm looking forward to getting another pair of insulated boots for snowmobiling and winter.
review.name: Comfortable, lightweight & traction

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: good fit and grip -- however they did not wear well at all. Side holes after about 125 miles of Sierra Nevada hiking, with a possible extra 25 miles of break in on local trails. In the Sierra, perhaps 25 miles would be considered "rough" off trail use -- but even that is generous (most off trail in Sierra alpine is pretty mellow). Return for credit. Picture shows left boot, right boot was just as damaged.
review.name: Severe wear after about 125 miles...

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve used for long hikes and mid mountains; on mud and dry terrain and they perform really well! I’m impressed how good isolated  they are on snow and moisture.
review.name: Great Hiking boots!

name: X Ultra 4 Mid GTX Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fits my foot comfortably right out of the box. True to size. Looks good. Happy with my purchase,
review.name: Black glove 7

review.reviewBody:
Perhaps I should have gone 5 stars. I shorted a star for durability but I’m very hard on shoes. I got second pair a half size larger than normal size because they are form fitting🥳 I work in very busy production line and when I tell you I’ll never buy another shoe for workplace,I mean it. Surefooted,lightweight an absolute upgrade to my performance. Thank you! 
 On second pair but need a 3rd here soon😔🥳
review.name: Favorite shoe

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. They are perfect for my lifting workouts!
review.name: Best Weight Lifting Shoe Ever!

review.reviewBody: Excellent trail shoe. Kept me safe and steady during my hikes on difficult terrains with slippery powder covered trails and uneven volcanic rock surfaces. I bought more for my kids going to Japan for hiking. The breathable mesh makes is super nice for warm temperatures and the grips are truly amazing. I feel as if my feet are almost sticking to the ground as I am hiking up rocks.
review.name: Excellent trail shoes

review.reviewBody:
Overall great shoe. Very comfortable. Didn't need to break in, but even more comfortable now that I'm a couple weeks into wearing. True to size: 8 is usually tight and 9 is too loose, so shout out to Merrell for their half size option, 8.5 was right on point, with just enough wiggle room for my toes to feel comfortable. I like the shape of the shoe because there's no pinching on the toes. Not waterproof, but the way the sole wraps the toe is nice for keeping feet dry from wet grass and such. Good grips on sole. soles squeak on hard floors when they're wet, but not usually. I wear these shoes outdoors, on trails, and also to work in a professional role, they're versatile and blend well with all of my outfits.
All in all great shoe, glad I purchased. I recommend.
review.name: Comfortable, Functional, Stylish

review.reviewBody: These ‘barefoot’ shoes were expensive.  They came with one lace frayed and now the tread has started to fail.  The rubber treads on the bottom of one shoe have started to get worn completely off after 3 hikes.  Not worth the money.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: A couple of years ago someone told me you didn't make barefoot shoes anymore, and the store Atmosphere doesn't carry them. Then a conversation with my osteopath led me to call Merrell once again, and voila! They really work well for me. My feet are narrow and these are so comfortabl, I leave them on much longer that I would do normal shoes. I just wish there was morepadding so I could wear them when the weather is cold
review.name: Great ahowa
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience Carole.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoes. I wear them mainly in the city, but never feel tired. Sizing guide is very accurate. I’d recommend to stick to it and not to your regular size. I wear 6.5, but bought 8.5.
review.name: Comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody: The rubber part of the toe rubs terribly in the front.  For barefoot shoes, it doesn't allow any comfort for the big toe.  Terrible changes to the shoes over the years. Truly defective design.  I tried to size up, but that does NOT help.
review.name: Very Disappointing for a long term customers

review.reviewBody: I wore them on my flight from Bradley International Airport in Hartford to Mobile Alabama 💋
review.name: Merrell's Trail Glove 7 Beautiful and Stylish

name: Trail Glove 7 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Currently putting this through the paces as rain coat and wind breaker on a 1500 mile tour including the High Country Route. Perfect compromise in weight between packability and performance in cooler weather. For comparison, I also have a heavier Showers Pass for winter commuting and a superlightweight POC for warmer rides. The Paclite fills the medium. If I could only afford one jacket - this would be it.
review.name: If I could only afford one jacket.

review.reviewBody: I took some time choosing this jacket over the Gore-Tex Torrent or Shake-Dry for a couple reasons. I wanted a basic waterproof jacket even though I value the ability to stow a jacket during the ride as the Shake-Dry will do. The Torrent jacket seems quite similar, only slightly more expensive. In the end all I really wanted was something waterproof and not too baggy, I have done a number of rides in every kind of wet and this jacket does the job. It will keep you warm and dry with a single long sleeve layer in 40 degree rain and can be stuffed in a pocket (more or less) if it gets sunny. Sleeves are plenty long enough with Velcro closures for over or under gloves. Right entry rear pocket is fine but zip chest pocket is better for grabbing a gel or bar without fussing around. I bought a Small I exchanged that for an XS and still have ample room for layering. I can wear this guy from mid 50's to sub freezing and be comfortable so I consider it a great piece bang-for-the-buck-wise.
review.name: GORE Wear Paclite Jacket Does its Duty

name: GORE-TEX Paclite Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I went to Utah to ride in the Wasatch mountains for a few days this summer and decided I was just suffering too much in my 34 x 34 on 10-12% grades while the guys with their 32 x 40 mountain bikes seemed a bit more relaxed.  I ordered the 45/29 from Backcountry and it arrived in time for me to get it installed in time to climb Haleakala the next week.  Its beautiful as one would expect from Campy.  More importantly, matched with my 2023 mechanical Record derailleurs, it shifts perfectly.
A couple of things:
1.  Backcountry posted the wrong photo so I did not realize it did not fit my Record BB (it showed the previous generation Super Record, with “Super” in red script, which does)
2.  The two piece axle has left hand thread but don’t assume (like I did,) that Record does as well.  It does not.
3.  Paired with my 11-34 Chorus cassette it could use higher gearing.  In 2024 Campy made a10-29 but not a 10-34.  When I do not need the 34, I use a 10-29 with a two link shorter chain.
review.name: Great gearing & shifting with Record

name: Super Record 12 WRL ProTech Crankset

description: Buy the Vittoria Syerra G2.0 4C DownCountry Tire - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Syerra G2.0 4C DownCountry Tire - 29in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Syerra G2.0 4C DownCountry Tire - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am currently using these on both front and rear. Replaced the Mais Minion/Magic Mary combo I had been riding through the winter. So far, they have met my expectations for less rolling resistance and great grip on dry/rooty trails along with puncture resistance through rock gardens.
review.name: Love these tir

review.reviewBody: I have not ridden these but as soon as they lose the red striping I'll be racing them as a front tire on my XC bike.  I just had a look at them at the local bike shop and the tread pattern looks to be ideal in pretty much all conditions with particular emphasis on the side knobs.  Low profile centers with good separation for shedding debris and mud and pronounced side knobs for aggressive cornering.  I currently run Barzo and love them.  Durable great all rounder which is what I believe these Syerra tires will be but&&I ain't in to the big red stripe.
review.name: What's with the red stripe

review.reviewBody: I have been running these tires front and rear for several months and love them! They are super fast rolling and supportive in the corners. These tires definitely live up to the claim as a "downcountry" tire. I am currently running them on my 2022 Santa Cruz Chameleon and love them for all-around trail riding and XC racing! I will say these tires seem to be a little smaller than some 2.4in tires I have used in the past but they still ride great! I would highly recommend these tires to any rider that wants a faster rolling trail tire, or to any XC racer that still wants a light weight, fast rolling tire, but also wants more support in the corners!
review.name: Great Aggressive XC/Trail Tire!

review.reviewBody: Disclaimer-  For the past year I ran an Agarro/Mazza 2.6" combo on my Ripley.  When I raced ran the Saguaro.  I like Vittoria and have had good luck with their tires.  To me Vittoria Tires seem to last much longer than Maxxis.  I will usually only ride a tire until it gets to 50% of it's original tread depth and then recycle it.  I have this Syerra mounted to an Element as a rear tire.  It seems to grab  better in all areas vs. the Recon it replaced.  It is a fast tire for sure and holds an edge better than the Recon too.  It weighs about the same and I feel it rolls every bit as well as the Recon.  I will probably run an Agarro up front when they become available.  It would be a pretty fast combo with enough bite for an aggressive XC/lite Trail bike.  I hope this tire lasts for a while as it is 100 grams lighter than the other Vittoria tires I have used.  The lighter Maxxis tires have sidewall issues at the most in-opportune times when I am far far away from the trailhead.  I ride rocky trails, but not overly sharp rocks.  Excited to try this tire out this season.   I will update the review as the season progresses.  I live in Northern Utah so not a ton of trails are open in my back yard right now since it is January.
review.name: More Aggressive than XC

review.reviewBody: I have always been in love with Vittoria tires and now they have released this beauty. That stability in looser stuff but benefits of a great xc tire. I will be for sure purchasing more
review.name: Perfect tire
comment:
Thanks so much for the review Brandan, glad you are liking the Syerra!!
-Blair (Vittoria Rep)

name: Syerra G2.0 4C DownCountry Tire - 29in

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these bags for a winter backcountry trip. They were perfect for stuffing down jackets and other clothing and equipment. They were lightweight, durable and highly recommended.
review.name: Great bags. Lightweight and durable.

review.reviewBody: After looking at dozens of different bags, I came across these. The 13L his be stuff sack for sleeping bag, the 5L for sleep clothes and will definitely use the 8L. I would definitely buy again! Good Bags!
review.name: Light, Waterproof and Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are awesome to have around for almost anything. They feel so soft I didn't know if it would soak up water but they have kept everything dry inside of them. I love the three different sizes so you can put almost anything you may need in inside and keep it with you. The smallest one is my favorite.
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received these just before we were to go on a kayaking trip.  These worked great for this trip and the different size options really made it nice. I used one for extra clothes, one for snacks and the other for miscellaneous things.  All three of them stayed dry the entire trip and I even dumped my kayak so everything was floating in the water would for sure recommend these to anyone.
review.name: Great WaterProof Bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These bags are very light weight but still sturdy and well made. I like that they are easy to wash in the sink or by hose, clean out and air dry. They held a good amount of weight without tearing. 10/10
review.name: Easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love these sea to summit bags. They keep everything dry and contained and I don’t have to worry about it. Great variety of sizes and colors to fit my needs and other people have given me compliments on them.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely loved these bags for our recent camping trip and hiking adventure. The bags came in a variety of nice, bright red colors, and the material was lightweight so it didn’t add extra weight. I was able to pack all of our clothes and foods in the appropriate sized bags and when the weather hit and it rained, everything stayed dry and fresh! I will totally recommend these for any type of camping or hiking whether it be long-term or just a short day trip.
review.name: Excellent waterproof and light weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really liked these multi bags. They came in three different sizes and there easy to use and I use them for almost anything. I like carrying it around and have things in it that I really need and the colors are wonderful and I can find it easier. There great to have around.
review.name: Different sizes

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stuff sack

Waterproof, weather proof! Great outdoor brand. Material is durable but lightweight. Bags are not near as big as I thought they would be in pictures though. Also no handle. I am disappointed with sizes, but overall quality is good
review.name: Sea to Summit bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely great! My husband and I are so impressed with these bags! They really do keep all the water and dirt out of the bags. They also keep everything dry which is most important when camping/traveling around
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Love these joggers, super comfy.  Getting the black pair soon...   I haven't noticed any bugs, so apparently they're working.  LOL  Either way, I could wear these everyday.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: Love love love these pants!!! So lightweight and comfortable. Also a very flattering fit! Would buy other colors!
So far I love the stretchy light material. I hope the bug off works as well. Mosquitoes will carry us off this summer!
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: comfortable stretch, cool & dried quickly!
Love them. Will let you know how they hold up to 4 months on the river!
review.name: Light & comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great pant! I am 5’2 and wear a size small and these pants fit true to size and are very flattering. They stretch so you can move and cast in any direction without feeling like you need to pull on them. The dry- wicking material makes them great for any day on the water. I highly recommend!
review.name: Stops bugs, not bones

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. Ordered one pair and instantly got another. Super comfortable and true-to-size fit.
review.name: The Best Pants!

review.reviewBody:
Home run for women in the outdoors! These joggers are a game changer. It’s nice to have a full coverage option for long days on the water that isn’t tight and restricting like leggings can be. They’re lightweight, breathable, and easy to move in. The fit is flattering and comfortable. The perfect jogger for on and off the water!  The zip pocket on the side is also an added bonus. I’ll be ordering more!   

I wear mediums for a more relaxed fit, small if you want them tighter fitting. I’m 5’8 145-150lbs.
review.name: Simms nailed it with these!

review.name: A+

hasVariant.name: Apex XT Bike Rack - 5 Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Apex XT Bike Rack - 5 Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The tie down straps unclip themselves whenever we drive the bikes on the highway. We had to pull over several times to redo the ties so our bikes wouldn’t fly off the back. We eventually bought additional zip ties/other straps to keep the bikes on the rack.
review.name: Bikes almost flew off

review.reviewBody: Order arrived 4 days after placing which was not planned but very welcome. We were able to use the bike rack for a trip where we had planned to borrow one and the Chasm 40L is a truly wonderful bag. Super water proof too! All in all, very pleased and looking forward to ordering more!
review.name: Wonderful products, amazing service

review.reviewBody: I bought the Thule Apex 5 for my family of 5. We each have adult mountain bikes. It is impossible to get 5 bikes on this rack without damaging the bikes. The bikes do NOT clamshell appropriately. The Apex 5 is best suited for 3 bikes and honestly that is even a bit tight. If you need a bike rack for four or more bikes do NOT busy this product.
review.name: Do NOT buy this

review.reviewBody: I was able to get five bikes on.  However,  my bike was damaged by the strap and the peddle from the bike next to it.  The cradle does not offer enough cushion and lossens up.  I recommend the product if you need a 5 bike rack.  It does take a beaten on a road trip from the bikes going up and down.
review.name: Works with risk...

review.reviewBody: Legit super durable & super easy to use for shuttling
review.name: Don’t cheat your self treat your self!!

review.reviewBody: This product has been awesome but today while my wife was driving down the highway one of the bikes flew off and now i B have s V fairly new trek Marlin 7 that now has two bent rims and probably more damage that we can’t see until the shop looks at it. Had this happened to anyone else?  Any suggestions to make sure this doesn’t happen again?
review.name: Bike flew off
comment:
Hello Andrew, 
Thank you for alerting us to the issue with your Thule Apex XT. I am sorry to hear about the damage to your bike.
Thule takes situations like this very seriously. Please visit the Thule warranty  page for more information on how to submit a claim so our technical service team can assess the situation and provide the next best steps towards resolution. 
https://www.thule.com/en-us/about-thule/warranty

review.reviewBody:
OUTSTANDING!!

I just purchased the 5 Bike Hitch Rack and drove 1600 miles from FL to MA. It is outstanding!  Easy to load and unload.  Very safe and stable during travel.   Car was a Chevy Tahoe.  

All the bikes were medium or large. (2 Hybrids, 2 Mountain, 1 Beach Cruiser)

Here’s the trick-
1.  Turn all the handlebars parallel to the bike before loading.  It can easily be done with an Allen Wrench.
2.  Buy and put crossbars on the bikes w no step over bar. Easy to use.  We had 2 of these bikes. 
3.  Wrap rags and duct tape on any places that bikes may rub. 

Super happy with the purchase.
review.name: Thule 5 Bike Hitch Rack

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Apex one month ago.  The shipping was faster than what I thought.
Once out of the box, it was easy to install with clear instructions.  It fits good in my 2 inches rack on my mini van.  It's a system that you need to lock with a screw and then insert a key so it can't be taken off.  There's a hook to secure everything, this looks not so sure but as it's made by thule, it comforts me.
I only try putting on 2 bikes (one adult/one kid) and it was quite easier than with my previous bike rack.  Negative point, the unused straps could fit tighter or smaller so it's even easier to insert the bike, but overall the rack was solid and couldn't guess it was there while driving.
The fact that it can be fold super fast to open the trunk or to reduce the space behind the car when it's unused is the completely awesome!
Overall, super satisfied!
review.name: Great as expected

review.reviewBody:
It works OK, it’s the same size of the 4 bicycle one, just added one more spot for a bike.
We have 3 large and 2 small bicycles and they barely fit, cannot imagine fitting 5 large bicycles.
But there are no other decent options for a 5 bicycle rack on the market.
OK for now for us.
review.name: Not a 5 bicycle rack

review.reviewBody: We travel to triathlons, or camping trips and we carry bikes with wheel sizes of 700C, 26", 24", 20", and 16".  They all fit and load up quickly.  We use the rack on a Landrover, a Tesla Model Y, and a 1987 VW Vanagon.  It is easy to attach the rack, and it has a non-obstructive profile when driving with no bikes on it.
review.name: Great rack for family of 5 (tire size aside)

name: Apex XT Bike Rack - 5 Bike

review.reviewBody: Superior quality. Black Diamond shows us America can still bring superior quality products to market. And if you ever have a problem with a BD product, contact them. They stand behind the products they produce!
review.name: The usual from Black Diamond!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is stretchy, breathable, and temperature regulating, good for the cold winter CrossFit gym and trail runs!
review.name: All the works

review.reviewBody: Great for layering. Terrible pocket location & only one chest pocket. If it had better pockets, this would be a favourite. If I use this, even for a quick round trip trail run I’m searching for pocket space. Not my favourite
review.name: Coefficient Hoody women’s size 8

review.reviewBody: I bought this hoody for my girlfriend so that she had a warm jacket for nordic ski sessions. We both liked the fit on her and the quality of construction. I'll try to find her little bit heavier jacket for the colder days.
review.name: Great mid-weight hoodie

review.reviewBody: Keep warm even if it’s light. Very breathable fabric that allows sweat to « evaporate ». Perfect for climbing and backcountry skiing :)
review.name: Love it !

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'10", 145 lb and ordered a size M. The length was good, long enough to go under harness however the sleeves were a bit short on me. Probably ok for most people thought. The cut was a bit weird where the arms were kind of baggy more like a men's shirt. Lastly and the reason I returned it was the material felt so fragile that 1 wear and I would expect a snag/hole. For something this light there are other shirts in the market I prefer. Also the bottom hem felt stretch out already. Like after you wear a shirt and if you pull at it too much it just looks stretched out and baggy where is would really be a bit more form fitting. All in all not worth the cost
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: I wore this on a recent alpine climbing trip to Mount Russell. It’s light enough to stick in an alpine pack without feeling the extra weight and kept me warm but not overly hot on the climb. Also love the color!
review.name: Perfect climbing layer!

review.reviewBody: This is going to be my new go to this summer. The small fit my 5'3" frame and it was fitted and flattering without being too tight. Love the colors.
review.name: Perfect in every way

review.reviewBody: Love the colour and basically everything about this hoody. However, all my jackets and prior sweaters from BD are a Large and I had to exchange this for a Medium because the Large was too big in the body.
review.name: Fits slightly Large

review.reviewBody:
Perfectly made, fits like a glove. I use mine for running in 40 degree weather. Great alone or under a windbreaker.
I am 5'3", 123 lb and the small fit perfectly.
review.name: Love This Warm, Lightweight Hoody

name: Coefficient LT Hybrid Hoodie - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Stone 45 Backpack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stone 45 Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Stone 45 Backpack online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Stone 45 replaced an older Dakine daypack that I was using when caving. The Dakine was loose and sloppy, and the fabric was a sponge for water and mud when I'm climbing underground. The BD pack is super comfortable, and the side zip for getting to gear quickly is genius!
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: I carry a ton of stuff when I trad climb, so usually go with my Creek 50 for a "typical" day, but I wanted something smaller for sport climbing and for when I travel to climb. The Stone 45 was perfect for a recent nine day climbing road trip. It ate up my double rack, 2.5 liters of water, food and other misc. items. I could have even carried the rope coiled under the hood with it's compression strap, but the rope was my partner's job! It fit close to my body and worked well when I had to scramble a bit of fourth class at one of the crags. Really happy that I bought this and highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect Climbing Pack

review.reviewBody: One big pocket fits everything you need for a day at the crag. Pockets in the hat fit snacks and water for easy access.
review.name: Great Pack

name: Stone 45 Backpack

review.reviewBody: Works great for working in the shop, inside, outside, whatever. It’s my new favorite piece of outerwear. Versatile and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: This jacket is great and comfy. Nice, casual and love that it's reversible!
review.name: Comfy Jacket

review.reviewBody: Wears wonderfully and the fleece side is particularly pleasant. I am happy with the colors and the model is nice and hip. A jacket that I like to wear!
review.name: very nice jacket

review.reviewBody: I get compliments on my jacket all the time. Plus it's comfortable and just warm enough for transition season.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Was so excited to see this jacket, but although it is reversible, there are no pockets for the hands on the flannel side. Side pockets are only on the quilted side. I felt cheated as the photo shows the flannel side out. You might want to mention in your description there are no pockets on the flannel side. So disappointing
review.name: Not What I Had Hoped

review.reviewBody: I bought in the Woods Plaid. I usually like extra room so I bought an XL but it was too big in the body and too roomy in the shoulders. I exchanged for a Large and it fits much better. It’s not super thick or heavy. The solid green side has side pockets and the plaid side has chest pockets. I wish the pockets were the same on both sides but it’s not a deal breaker. Great for layering. I live in Minnesota so this will transition well to colder weather with l long sleeve crew neck Tshirt and insulated vest over it. Works great in windy 40° weather and up. Snap up front makes it very easy on and off.
review.name: Great Versatile Piece!

review.reviewBody: Flannel was comfy and nice here for winter in Denver.

review.reviewBody: This is the best life jacket I've ever owned. One downside is it's hard to get off compared to others that unclip.
review.name: Rescue vest size small

review.reviewBody: The Astral Green jacket pfd is extremely comfortable and in no way feels like it limits movement when paddling. I needed a rescue pfd for my work with search and rescue. Although I have not used it to date on a mission I am sure it will perform well. I could not be more satisfied with this pfd.
review.name: Green Jacket

review.reviewBody: The Greenjacket is the best PFD I have ever owned, I wear it almost everyday for 4 months straight and it's comfortable, easy to use, and has plenty of storage for all my stuff. Definitely recommend it for anyone doing work on the water.
review.name: Supremely comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I love my Greenjacket. It is the perfect blend of storage and comfort. I can playboat and be flexible in it and still carry whatever I need. I really love the clamshell, it is spacious without being too bulky. I also like how it opens and makes a little space to set things when opened most of the way if I am in a calm spot or on the riverbank.
It is also very comfortable for a long day on the water.
review.name: Personal favorite PFD

review.reviewBody: It does it's job as a pfd very well - it's lovely and floaty as well as comfortable. I love the waterproof canvas and how quickly the whole jacket dries. It did arrive with a slash in the canvas at the back (only cosmetic but not ideal) and the zips get stuck sometimes on the clamshell which is more of a problem when I'm trying to open and close the pocket quickly.
review.name: Good but not perfect

review.reviewBody: Had my first water rescue with my new gear. Fit well. I have to get used to putting it on over my head and not like a jacket. I won't use the personal throw bag at work, only for my personal rafting.
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: Best rescue vest on the market. Super comfortable to boot. I’ve used an earlier iteration for almost 20 years for both swift water rescue and open water/ocean applications. This vest has performed exceptionally well in training. I’m convinced it will surpass my old version in real rescues. And they have upped the anti with comfort, flotation, and style.
review.name: 20+ years of experience, I would choose no other.

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket, I primarily use it for sea kayaking, coaching, guiding, clinics, and courses. I went with the green jacket because of its durability, wish it came with side entry.
review.name: Love the green jacket

review.reviewBody: As a raft guide, I love the green jacket. rafting Christal Clearwater is always nice but going to glacier/sediment filled Rivers kills all PFDs. Remember your safety get a new PFD.
review.name: Safty First

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket to replace an old Wonder Pro. I wanted a PFD with a rescue belt. I tried on all the major brands’ rescue jackets and this one seemed to fit the best. But it still squishes my boobs and I’m not even that busty. The Wonder Pro had space for boobs and was so comfortable. I looked at the Layla and it fit the best and I like that you can add the belt, but I wanted a more substantial pocket. I feel like brands have kind of gone backwards in terms of women specific rescue vests. They all seem to be unisex, but in reality, we’re built differently and need a rescue vest that fits a woman’s body. While not super comfortable, it does the job and will keep me afloat. It’s a high quality piece of gear. I’m not a huge fan of the knife placement either as it gets caught when self rescuing in a raft but I’m also short so it’s easy to get snagged. I just Astral offered a women’s specific version of the green jacket and the indus.
review.name: Solid PFD, maybe not the best fit for women

name: Green Jacket Personal Flotation Device

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this jersey in the "blue" color which is really a bright turquoise, enhancing my visability on the road.

I've worn this on several cold mornings in the mid 40's (California--it's relative) and I was still comfortable when it warmed up to the low 60's.  I wore this with a wool tank/short sleeve T underneath and layered a wind vist over it.  Jersey kept me comfortable climbing as well.

High quality, flattering cut, comfort and visability on the road--you won't be disappointed!

review.reviewBody: I've seen a few other reviews say they were only good down to the 40s, but I've never had cold toes even down to the low 30s. Well insulated and well built. I'm not crazy about the lacing system. The Boa works well but I'd prefer to control the lower portion of the boot individually from the upper. Having to crank down the fit around the ankle to tighten the boot below isn't ideal. In terms of fit, they're generous width, even in the standard fit. They do run about 1 size small tho.
review.name: Really Good Spring/Fall Boots

review.reviewBody:
I bought these after a cold ride where my feet were almost frostbitten. They work great for me with normal cycling socks down to about 35 F, then work great with thicker socks below that. Of course wind and sun change the equation. I have worn them up to about 50 F and my feet did not overheat. Coldest I've tried was around 30 F with gusty winds and my feet were a bit cold after a few hours but a lot better off than regular shoes with booties.

They are tight and a bit of work to get into, but they have loosened up some and are a bit easier now. Check the Lake site for sizing up recommendations. I followed their recommendations versus my Lake road shoes and it worked well. The single BOA buckle works pretty well. More buckles would give a bit better resolution when adjusting the fit but I think the one buckle works well enough. I'm definitely glad I bought them.
review.name: Great winter boots

review.reviewBody: The MX146 is a terrific midweight boot (20~50F/7~10C).  I also have MX303 (replaced with 304) heavy boot (below 20F/-7C).  Both boots are very comfortable.  Great for hike-a-bike sections.  They are waterproof and windproof.  I've had the 303 for many years and they are holding up great. I've only had the 146 a couple months, but they appear to have similar build quality.  I expect they will last a long time too.  When it comes to cycling boots, the flap that covers the front of the boot is a must-have.  Other boots I've had leak melting snow and splashing water through the zipper or lace.  Also, the cleat slots are sealed whereas other boots are not.  These boots keep my feet dry in slushy snow and even when my foot breaks through the frozen creek.  My normal shoe size is 45.5.  The 303 fit best in size 46.  The 146 fit best in size 47.  This is with a normal weight sock not thin cycling sock or heavy wool sock.  I don't need a heavy sock with either of these boots.  They are warm enough with a normal midweight sock.
review.name: Best mountain bike boot!

review.reviewBody:
According to a prominent warning on the shoe, you must use a shim with your cleats or you void the warranty.  Therefore, you are not going to be able to ride your shoes immediately after they arrive unless you order some additional parts first..  The warning says that "Spring Binder Style" cleats, like Crankbrothers, Look, Time, and HT, "must use Shoe Shield or Shims that are provided by the pedal manufacturers.  The Shields protect the shoe sole from friction and eventual sole breaking."  I'm using Shimano SPD cleats (SM-SH51), therefore that doesn't apply to me, but the general install instructions say that you should install your cleats with a 0.,25-1mm gap between the cleat bottom and the sole bottom.   I used some doubled up thin cardboard from a six pack of beer to make some roughly 0.5 mm thick shims.  I looked around and Shimano makes some 1.0mm shims for my SPD cleats (part number YL8098030).  You can see them on Shimano's website if you search for "SPD Cleat Spacer", and Shimano states "For SPD Cleats (SM-SH51/SM-SH56)".   I ordered the spacers from amazon for $10, and when they arrive, I will replace my cardboard shims.  Note that SPD cleats (as well as the Shimano spacers) have small teeth on the bottom that dig into the plastic sole of a cycling shoe, so my cardboard shims may not prevent the cleat from moving.  Next, Lake says the cleat should also be 0.25mm - 1.0mm inset from the ground.  With no shim, I measured from the cleat to the top of the lugs on the sole, and the cleat was inset about 1.5-2mm.  I also measured the inset for the same cleats I use on my Specialized Recon 2.0 cycling shoes, and it is about the same 1.5-2mm, and I installed them with no shims.  I'm a little worried that the Shimano 1.0mm shims may make the cleat extend too close to the top of the lugs, which will scratch the floors when I walk around inside.

For comparison, I ordered the Lake MXZ304 Mountain Bike Shoe, which also requires a shim for your cleats and which I like better than the Lake MX146.  Seem my review of the Lake MXZ304 Mountain Bike Shoe for sizing tips.  The sizing of the  Lake MX146 was somewhat similar to the MXZ304: the 48's were too small, and the 50 fit, but the size 50 in the MX146 felt too big and sloppy.  Also, the elastic cuff around the top of the MX146  is loose and has gaps, so snow, rain, etc can get in.   The cuff on the MXZ304 fits snugly, but I think you would have to employ some waterproof gaiters to really prevent stuff from getting in the top of the MXZ304, which has a ring on the toe for gaiters.  I also don't think the MX146 will be warm enough for me, so I am going to return the MX146 and keep the MXZ304.
review.name: Shim required for cleats

name: MX146 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Equipe RS Alleycat Clima Capsule Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve used it in a descent from Haleakala, a long ride in 45F and pouring rain, as an outer layer in 25F … worked great as a shell, rain jacket and an extra layer, while being tiny to put in your back pocket. One of the most valuable pieces of equipment I have … and I have quite a bit. ;)
review.name: Versatile and handy …

review.itemreviewed: Equipe RS Alleycat Clima Capsule Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Assos Alleycat emergency jacket is great.  It has a racing cut and lots of technology.  I use this jacket a lot on cool early mornings before the sun is fully up.  The jacket is extremely reflective and provides just enough protection until the sun heats things up.  It packs down small when not in use.  I tend to grab the full Assos Equip RS raincoat in rainy conditions so I haven’t yet tried the Alleycat in the rain.
review.name: Emergency perfection

name: Equipe RS Alleycat Clima Capsule Jacket - Men's
